sentence: He’s running against former television host Dr. Mehmet Oz, former Republican nominee for lieutenant governor Jeff Bartos, and former Trump administration Ambassador Carla Sands (who saw a major staff exodus among lackluster fundraising numbers).
author: Daniel Strauss
title: Democrats Can Win the Pennsylvania Senate Seat—if They Don’t Slaughter One Another First

sentence: Down the Ballot WEEKEND UPDATE — “How Orlando became the center of the universe for GOP Senate hopefuls,” by Natalie Allison, POLITICO: “Mehmet Oz has less than 90 days left before Pennsylvania Republican voters cast their ballots in one of the most contentious Senate primaries in the nation.

sentence: Celebrity doctor Mehmet Oz is already in talks to return to television if his candidacy for U.S. Senate in Pennsylvania is unsuccessful, according to a recent report.
author: Blarp Blog
title: Report: Oz Looks to Exit Senate Race, Return to Television

sentence: "To make matters worse, a poll recently commissioned by Lamb’s own super PAC showed his main Democratic opponent — John Fetterman — not just beating him in a primary where the more liberal candidate often has more traction; polling showed Fetterman as the better candidate in a general election, against potential GOP nominees like Dr. Mehmet Oz."

title: Biden-snubbed Conor Lamb says 'the race is wide open' for Pennsylvania Senate — but is that what the numbers say?

sentence: In Pennsylvania, for example, he endorsed Dr. Mehmet Oz who, like Trump, was a longtime TV personality before entering politics.
title: Mitch McConnell openly attacks Trump

sentence: — Donald Trump wading into primaries and endorsing candidates who may not be the party’s best choice for the general election, such as television doctor Mehmet Oz (R) in Pennsylvania.

title: Sabato: Republicans 'Favorites' to Take Senate
